docs.title: Welcome, new trainee!
docs.text: This is a documentation to learn the basics of the FiSi trainee program.

docs.title: Order
docs.text:
• First, we will setup a basic network with an FritzBox router and a client. This will be your first start to get familiar with the basics.
  • After that, we will setup a virtual network with Mininet. We will mainly use this to test our configuration before deploying it on real hardware.
  • Then we will setup a real network with a router and real switches.
  • Finally, we will setup some servers and services to get a infrastructure like a company would have (e.g. a webserver, a mailserver, a fileserver, ...)

docs.title: First start
docs.text: For the first start we will setup a basic network with an FritzBox router and a client. The client will be a virtual machine running on your computer.

docs.title: Mininet
docs.text: We will use Mininet to emulate a network topology, so you can test your configuration before deploying it on real hardware.

docs.title: Install Proxmox
docs.text: Proxmox is a virtualization platform based on Debian. It is free and open source. It is a good alternative to VMware ESXi.

docs.title: Download Proxmox
docs.text: Download the latest version of Proxmox from the Proxmox website.

docs.title: First VM
docs.text:
Now that we have Proxmox installed, let's create our first VM.
